definition: tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: They would have continued to struggle against economic odds and would have lived in obscurity.
sentences.chinese: 他们会继续过紧巴巴的日子，默默无闻地活着。

sentences.english: This coat is slightly tight for me.
sentences.chinese: 这件大衣我穿有点紧巴巴的。

sentences.english: His skin was stretched drum-tight over his bony frame.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤紧巴巴地绷在骨架子上。

sentences.english: In those days Pakistan tight, Mom always endured hunger.
sentences.chinese: 在那段紧巴的日子里，妈妈总是忍着饥饿。

definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
Fuyu county in Qiqihar 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
